block.p: CHEVRON CORP., -- San Francisco, the second-largest oil company in the United States, is seeking buyers for its share of a 90,0000-barrel-a-day refinery complex in El Paso, along with associated pipelines and storage tanks.

USFREIGHTWAYS CORP., -- Chicago, an owner of regional trucking and freight-management companies, said it would buy back as much as 3.8 percent of about 26.3 million shares outstanding, which would total as many as one million shares.

STANDARD MICROSYSTEMS CORP., -- Hauppauge, N.Y., a chip and circuit maker, said it would double the number of shares it can repurchase to two million. The company has almost 15.9 million shares outstanding.
AVISTA CORP., -- Spokane, Wash., an owner of utilities, acquired the rights to build a 280-megawatt power plant near Boardman, Ore., from the Enron Corp., Houston, for an undisclosed price.
